column4: Hello. I'm sorry, but I've encountered a rather large problem....Nothing will open when I doube click on it and I don't know why
It just barely started, but when I double click on a picture it'll lose it's icon, if I doube click on an mp3 it'll lose it's icon...They both just turn into sheets of paper
Have you rebooted yet?
Not yet, since I'm in the middle of working on a document, and I'm afraid that if I reboot I won't be able to get back into Ubuntu or something :\
Is the mouse USB or PS/2?
Mouse is USB
Have you unplugged/replugged it in?
No, I haven't. I'll do that now, but why would that help?
I guess just kind of power-cycling the mouse.  It probably needs a reboot.  That doesn't sound like something that would keep you from booting again.
Did we lose you?

I'm not sure if I described the problem. The mouse works fine: It's just that nothing at all will open. When I look at properties, everything has become "type: unknown". I can still open actual programs (through the terminal or the applications menu), but not by double clicking
Hmm. When I open folders, it tells me that it can't display the contents of anything
That's odd.  If you have another system, email that document to yourself and try a reboot.
It isn't rebooting.
Should I press the power button on my computer? :\ I've heard that it is best to let the OS handle that sort of thing, but Ubuntu is just sitting there
Did the menu for shut down/restart, etc show up?
No, it didn't. I click on the icon but nothing happens
Hit alt+ctrl+del to bring it up
Alright, it comes up that way. I'm going to try rebooting now...Will I be able to use a Live CD or something to come back in case something bad happens?
Yeah, you should.
Alright. Be right back, hopefully
Hello again. Rebooting seems to have solved whatever the issue was, so I guess nothing too bad happened :) Thanks for your help, though :)
Always glad to help.  I didn't think it sounded serious.
